SEARCH
Package com.example.wizard_project.Controllers

Class EventController

java.lang.Object
com.example.wizard_project.Controllers.EventController
public class EventController extends Object
EventController acts as a communicator between the database and Event objects. It provides methods to create, retrieve, update, and delete events in the Firestore database.

  • Method Details

    • createEvent

      public void createEvent(Event newEvent, String userId, EventController.createCallback callback)
      Creates a new event and saves it to the Firestore database.
      Parameters:
      newEvent - The event to be created.
      userId - The ID of the user creating the event.
      callback - The callback to handle success or failure.

    • getEventList

      public void getEventList(String facilityId, EventController.eventCallback callback)
      Retrieves a list of all events for a specific facility from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      facilityId - The ID of the facility to retrieve events for.
      callback - A callback interface to handle the retrieved events.

    • updateEvent

      public void updateEvent(Event event, EventController.updateCallback callback)
      Updates an existing event in the database.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to be updated.
      callback - The callback to handle success or failure.

    • getWaitingList

      public void getWaitingList(String eventId, @NonNull EventController.WaitingListCallback callback)
      Retrieve the list of users in the waiting list for an event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The event whose waiting list is checked.
      callback - A callback interface containing the list of waitlisted users.

    • setDrawCount

      public void setDrawCount(Event event, int drawCount)
      Sets the draw count for an event.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to update.
      drawCount - The new draw count.

    • getDrawCount

      public void getDrawCount(Event event, EventController.drawCountCallback callback)
      Gets the draw count for an event.
      Parameters:
      event - The event whose draw count is retrieved.

    • updateField

      public void updateField(Event event, String field, String update)
      Updates a specific field of a event in the database.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to update
      field - The field to update
      update - The new value for the field.

    • deleteEvent

      public void deleteEvent(String eventId, EventController.deleteCallback callback)
      Deletes an event from the database.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to delete.
      callback - Callback for success or failure.

    • fetchAllEvents

      public void fetchAllEvents(EventController.eventCallback callback)
      Fetches all events from the database.
      Parameters:
      callback - A callback interface containing a list with all events.

    • updateEntrantStatus

      public void updateEntrantStatus(Event event, Entrant entrant)
      Updates an entrant's status attribute in the database.
      Parameters:
      event - The event the entrant is registered under.
      entrant - The entrant whose status is updated.
